National Day of DPRK Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
National Day of DPRK Observed in Different Countries 
   Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Seminars, lectures, photo exhibitions and film shows were held by the Bangladesh People's League, the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung, the Rabitra Bahtera Pratama Co. and the P. T. Karyamas Kaltim Prima Co. of Indonesia, and the Senat Ship and Trading Private Limited Co. of Singapore from Sept. 1 to 4 on the occasion of the 58th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
 On display in the venues of the functions were famous works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos showing their undying Songun leadership exploits.    
 Participants of the film shows watched Korean films including "The Brilliant History of the Great Leadership" and "55th Founding Anniversary of the DPRK."

articles.title: Malaysian King on Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Malaysian King on Relations with DPRK 
   Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Malaysian King Tuanku Syed Sirajuddin Ibni Al-Marhum Tuanku Syed Putra Jamalullail received credentials from DPRK Ambassador to Malaysia Pak Ryong Yon on Sept. 7.
 Referring to the relations between the two countries that have favorably developed in recent years, the king underscored the need to explore the possibility of boosting them and develop the bilateral exchange and cooperation not only at the governmental level but at the non-governmental level.

articles.title: U.S. Test-fire of Interceptor Missile under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Test-fire of Interceptor Missile under Fire in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification reportedly issued a statement titled "The U.S., stop at once its test-fire of interceptor missile targeted against the north" on September 5.
 Accusing the Missile Defense Agency of the U.S. Department of Defense of conducting a test-fire of an interceptor missile targeted against the DPRK on September 1, the statement noted that the test-fire indicates that the U.S. scenario to invade the DPRK has gone beyond the danger line.    
 It manifested the resolution of the headquarters to stage a more dynamic nationwide struggle to defend peace and force the U.S. forces in south Korea, the root cause of a nuclear war, to quit it.

articles.title: Floral Basket Sent to DPRK Embassy in Havana
articles.content:
Floral Basket Sent to DPRK Embassy in Havana
   Havana, September 8 (KCNA) -- Gen. Raul Castro Ruz, first vice-president of the Council of State and minister of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba, sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Havana on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of the DPRK.
 The basket was placed before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il at the embassy.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from IIJI Director-General
   Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea on a visit to the DPRK.
 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned on Saturday by Director-General Vishwanath.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from IIJI Delegation
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from IIJI Delegation
   Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from a delegation of the Secretariat of the International Institute of the Juche Idea on a visit to the DPRK on the occasion of its 58th birthday.
 The basket was handed over to an official concerned on Saturday by IIJI Secretary General Kenichi Ogami, head of the delegation.

Struggle against FTA Declared
articles.content:
Struggle against FTA Declared
   Pyongyang, September 9 (KCNA) -- Men of culture and artistes affiliated to the solidarity council for the world organization of culture reportedly held a press conference in Seoul on September 5 and vowed to wage the struggle against the conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. "Free Trade Agreement"(FTA).
 A declaration signed by 1,417 men of culture and artistes was read out at the press conference.    
 Noting that it is the way of protecting the life of the people and defending national culture to prevent the conclusion of FTA, the declaration said that men of culture and artistes would preserve the soul of the nation through the powerful struggle.

Greetings to Tajik President
articles.content:
Greetings to Tajik President
   Pyongyang, September 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greetings to Emomali Rakhmonov, president of Tajikistan, on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of its national day.
 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop on better terms in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Delegation and Delegates of Organizations for Study of Juche Idea Here
articles.content:
Delegation and Delegates of Organizations for Study of Juche Idea Here
   Pyongyang, September 9 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Secretariat of the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI) led by Secretary General Kenichi Ogami arrived here on Sept. 9 to participate in the 10th meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the IIJI.
 On the same day, Reggie Ranatunge, director general of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party, Edmond Jouve, director general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, Matteo Carbonenli, vice-chairman of the Italian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, and Alva Chavez, secretary general of the Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea, and her party arrived here.
